contactPoint.fn: Ms. Katanya Madison

publisher.name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

dataset.description: This dataset contains the total number of enacted direct positions for the years 2007 to 2015. The totals are categorized by program area, location, grade series, and functional area. Note: The number of enacted positions differs from the total number of employees. Direct positions equate to the number of billets funded, while employees represent the total number of personnel onboard at a given point in time.
dataset.title: Direct Positions: 2007 to 2015

publisher.name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

contactPoint.fn: Ms. Katanya Madison

contactPoint.fn: Ms. Katanya Madison

publisher.name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

dataset.description: This dataset contains the ATF enacted budget by year from 2007 to 2015. The dataset includes breakouts for both program categories and for strategic goals. The program categories were modified in 2013 to include Law Enforcement Operations and Investigative Support Services. Prior to then they included: Firearms, Arson & Explosives, and Alcohol & Tobacco. The DOJ goals include "Prevent Terrorism and Promote the Nation's Security Consistent with the Rule of Law" and "Prevent Crime, Protect the Rights of the American People, and enforce Federal Law"
dataset.title: Enacted Budget: FY2007 to FY2015

dataset.title: National Firearms Act Importers, Manufacturers, and Dealers by State: 2010 to 2014

publisher.name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

dataset.description: The dataset contains manufacturing and export numbers for pistols, revolvers, rifles, shotguns, and miscellaneous firearms from 1990 to 2012. All Federally licensed manufacturers of firearms and destructive devices are required to submit a production report of manufacturing and export activity to ATF. dataset.title: ATFNews Article June 6, 2015 - Public

contactPoint.fn: The Office of Public and Governmental Relations

publisher.name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives

dataset.description: (1) Firearm traces are designed to assist law enforcement authorities in conducting investigations by tracking the sale and possession of specific firearms. Law enforcement agencies may request firearms traces for any reason, and those reason are not necessarily reported to the Federal Government. Not all firearms used in crime are traced and not all firearms traced are used in a crime. (2) Firearms selected for tracing are not chosen for purposes of determining which types, makes or models of firearms are used for illicit purposes. The firearms selected do not constitute a random sample and should not be considered representative of the larger universe of all firearms used by criminals, or any subset of that universe. Firearms are normally traced to the first retail seller, and sources reported for firearms traced do not necessarily represent the sources or methods by which firearms in general are acquired for use in crime.
dataset.title: Trace Report - Wyoming - 2006

publisher.name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives

dataset.description: 2013 Kentucky Trace Report - (1) Firearm traces are designed to assist law enforcement authorities in conducting investigations by tracking the sale and possession of specific firearms. Law enforcement agencies may request firearms traces for any reason, and those reason are not necessarily reported to the Federal Government. Not all firearms used in crime are traced and not all firearms traced are used in a crime. (2) Firearms selected for tracing are not chosen for purposes of determining which types, makes or models of firearms are used for illicit purposes. The firearms selected do not constitute a random sample and should not be considered representative of the larger universe of all firearms used by criminals, or any subset of that universe. Firearms are normally traced to the first retail seller, and sources reported for firearms traced do not necessarily represent the sources or methods by which firearms in general are acquired for use in crime.

dataset.description: 2013 North Dakota Trace Report - (1) Firearm traces are designed to assist law enforcement authorities in conducting investigations by tracking the sale and possession of specific firearms. Law enforcement agencies may request firearms traces for any reason, and those reason are not necessarily reported to the Federal Government. Not all firearms used in crime are traced and not all firearms traced are used in a crime. (2) Firearms selected for tracing are not chosen for purposes of determining which types, makes or models of firearms are used for illicit purposes. The firearms selected do not constitue a random sample and should not be considered representative of the larger universe of all firearms used by criminals, or any subset of that universe. Firearms are normally traced to the first retail seller, and sources reported for firearms traced do not necessarily represent the sources or methods by which firearms in general are acquired for use in crime.
dataset.title: 143886-ndatfwebsite13

eFormsNews serves as an exchange of information to the registered users of ATFs eForms System and ATFs Firearms and Explosives
Services Division. Because of the large increase in new users we have dedicated this edition of the eFormsNews to
basic instructions on how to use the eForms system in addition to the current topics of interest. We hope that you find the
information contained in eFormsNews informative. If you have topics or questions that you would like to see published in
eFormsNews or would like to request previous editions of eFormsNews send your request to Lee.Alston-Williams@atf.gov.
